intro: Elaterium hastatum, commonly known as the sharpleaf elaterium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ribbed stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks. Elaterium hastatum is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing benefits.
